page.title: 16CHANGING TIMES IN FARLEY
page.content: We chose the year 1953 and interviewed three people to find out the changes between now, 1985, and then. The people were Mrs. G.Williams (aged 80), Mr. F.C.Bray (76) and Mr. Francis Bray (38), father and son. They say the population has not changed in size but the people have changed. There are more newcomers and the village is less working class. They all feel that there is less of a village atmosphere now. The land is still used for farming, now more technical. Less people work on the farms now. Mrs. Williams said there were more sheep years ago. Transport has changed drastically. Mr. Francis Bray said there were only two cars in the village, although his father Mr. Bray had a lorry as he was the local "carrier". They all remember
